workflow.name: Crypto RSI alert system with EODHD, Telegram and TradingView charts
workflow.description:
**How it works**

Runs on a schedule and iterates a watchlist of symbols (e.g., BTC/ETH/SOL).

For each symbol, request intraday 1h OHLCV from EODHD.

A Code node computes Wilder‚Äôs RSI(14) and detects 30/70 crossings.

When a signal appears, the bot sends a Telegram alert (HTML message) with price, RSI (prev ‚Üí now), timestamp, and a ‚ÄúView chart‚Äù button that opens the pair on TradingView (BINANCE/USD).

**Set up steps (‚âà10‚Äì15 min)**

Prereqs: n8n (cloud or self-hosted), EODHD API key, Telegram bot + your chat_id.

Env vars: set EODHD_TOKEN and TELEGRAM_CHAT_ID on your n8n instance.

Credentials: add your Telegram credential (bot token).

Import the workflow JSON.

Edit Fields node: adjust the symbol array to your watchlist.

Schedule Trigger: choose how often to run (e.g., every 5‚Äì10 min).

Test: temporarily flip the Code node‚Äôs FORCE_ALERT flag to true to verify Telegram delivery, then set it back to false.

EODHD API [Access the EODHD API with a 10% discount](https://eodhd.com/pricing-special-10?via=kmg&ref1=Meneses)

parameters.content:
## Crypto RSI Alert Bot (overview)
- Runs on a schedule or manual trigger.
- Iterates a **watchlist** (BTC/ETH/SOL).
- Fetches **intraday 1h** OHLCV from **EODHD** for each symbol.
- Code node computes **Wilder's RSI(14)** and detects **30/70** crossings.
- On signal, sends a **Telegram** alert (HTML) + **View chart** button (TradingView BINANCE/USD).

Env vars required:
- `EODHD_TOKEN`
- `TELEGRAM_CHAT_ID`

### Edit Fields (watchlist)
- Defines the **symbol array**.
- Make sure the field type is **Array** (String[]), not a single String.
- Example output: `{ symbol: ["BTC-USD.CC","ETH-USD.CC","SOL-USD.CC"] }`

### Split Out
- Explodes the array into **one item per symbol**.
- Input: 1 item with array ‚Üí Output: N items like `{ symbol: "BTC-USD.CC" }`.

### Loop Over Items
- Processes **one symbol per pass** to avoid mixing BTC/ETH/SOL candles.
- Wiring: **Loop ‚Üí HTTP ‚Üí Code ‚Üí back to Loop**. **Done ‚Üí IF**.

### HTTP (EODHD)
- Fetches **intraday 1h OHLCV** for current symbol.
- Token via env var `EODHD_TOKEN` ‚Üí no secret in JSON.
- **Split Into Items** enabled: 1 candle = 1 item (~2‚Äì3k items).

### Code (RSI + message)
- Sorts candles, computes **RSI(14)** (Wilder), detects 30/70 crossings.
- Builds HTML message + TradingView URL (BINANCE/USD).
- Testing: set `FORCE_ALERT = true`, then back to `false`.

### Telegram (delivery)
- Parse Mode: **HTML**.
- Text: `{{$json.alertTextHtml}}`.
- Button: **View chart** ‚Üí `{{$json.tradingViewUrl}}`.
- Chat ID via env var `TELEGRAM_CHAT_ID`.
- Bot token stays in Credentials.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.

data.details: The Code node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow.
